item.title: Large loose concrete slabs, 1st April
item.description:
Outside 18 Wincel Road there are large loose concrete slabs that constitute a significant trip hazard.

item.title: Daisy Bank Road is a disgrace, chunks of tarmac damage and height drops all the way up tot he car park. I have now lived here for nearly 3 years and nothing has been done about it despite the reporting of the issue. I pay over £300 a month for my CT and am not seeing any value for that let alone a pride in the area covered!! To put it into perspective moving from London where my CT was £85 a month there was far better upkeep and modernising of the area near me., 1st April
item.description:
Entrance to Daisy Bak Road from Leckhampton Hill all the way up to the UnderScar property past both car parks. Stop ignoring the residents here!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daisybank Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Area like a magnet for filth, 1st April
item.description:
Comes, shopping trolleys, lots of general wrappers and bottles. This area seems to get this this within weeks of when it was last cleaned

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Gristmill Close, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obscured zig zag and other yellow lines, 31st March
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Battledown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
